content: the same strap at each short end should be separated by 7 stitches if needed place the extra or one less stitch in either of these sections designed by crochet by those_yellow_things your source for unique handmade items c on each long side of the bag the long strap and short strap should be 7 stitches apart on both sides long strap row 1 in the first blue stitch marker to the left of the green marker attach with spike st going around the chain and into the st below *chain 1 skip st spike in next st* until you reach next blue stitch marker 2 turn chain 2 *skip st spike in next st chain 1* across omit last st first spike from row 1 note this will cause your strap to be slightly uneven at the beginning but after the strap is complete you cannot tell designed by crochet by those_yellow_things your source for unique handmade items 3 turn chain 2 *skip st spike in next st chain 1* across single_crochet in chain 2 space repeat row 3 until strap measures 48 cm or desired fasten_off and leave tail for sewing attach and sew end of strap in between the blue stitch markers on the opposite side of bag be careful not to twist strap weave in ends short strap row 1 in the first red stitch marker to the left of the green marker attach with spike st going around the chain and into the st below *chain 1 skip st spike in next st* until you reach next red stitch marker 2 turn chain 2 *skip st spike in next st chain 1* across omit last st first spike from row 1 note this will cause your strap to be slightly uneven at the beginning but after the strap is complete you cannot tell 3 turn chain 2 *skip st spike in next st chain 1* across single_crochet in chain 2 space repeat row 3 until strap measures 16cm or about 1/3 the size of the long strap fasten_off and leave tail for sewing attach and sew end of strap in between the red stitch markers on the opposite side of bag be careful not to twist strap weave in ends designed by crochet by those_yellow_things your
